fields.name: Account & Registration
fields.desc: category for questions related to accounts and registration

fields.question: What is the Place of Worship portal?
fields.answer: Places of Worship portal (pow) is an online platform that provides an interface to collect information on various places of worship located in India. The approved contributions are curated and published on the Indian Culture portal.

fields.question: What is a Place of Worship?
fields.answer: A place of worship is a specially designed structure or space where individuals or a group of people such as a congregation come to perform acts of devotion, veneration, or religious study. A building constructed or used for this purpose is sometimes called a house of worship. Temples, Churches, Mosques, Gurudwaras, and Synagogues are examples of structures created for worship.

fields.question: Q: Which places of worship will you find?
fields.answer:
The following types of places of worship can be found
  1. Hindu Temple
  2. Church
  3. Masjid and Dargah
  4. Gurudwara
  5. Fire Temple
  6. Jain Temple
  7. Buddhist Temple
  8. Bahai Temple
  9. Synagogue

fields.question: Who can contribute to the Places of Worship portal?
fields.answer: Any registered (signed up) user can make a contribution on the pow portal.

fields.question: How to become a contributor on the Places of Worship portal?
fields.answer: A visitor can become a contributor by signing up (registering) on the pow portal.

fields.question: Where do I contribute on the Places of Worship portal?
fields.answer:
To contribute on the places of worship portal, you first need to choose any one from the 9 faiths i.e. Hindu temple, Church, etc. Thereafter, go ahead and select a place of worship under the faith. Each place of worship is divided into the following categories in which you can contribute.
  • Introduction
  • Architecture
  • Ritual
  • Ceremonies
  • Records
  • Tales
  • More Information
  • Gallery

fields.question: In what ways can I contribute on the portal?
fields.answer:
You can contribute in one of the following ways:
  • Write an article
  • Upload image
  • Upload audio
  • Upload video
As an alternative to uploading, you can provide links to images, audio, and video. While providing links for audio/video, embed URL will be preferred so as to render the content. Incase content from the link cannot be rendered, only the link will be visible. To view the content one would need to click the link. The YouTube embed URL will be similar to: https://www.youtube.com/embed/X...

fields.question: What are the various stages/states of contribution?
fields.answer:
When a contributor contributes content on this portal, it goes through the following states:
  • Draft: When you create a contribution and save it.
  • Submit: When you submit the saved contribution. You are allowed to make further modifications.
  • In review: The curator has started reviewing your contribution. At this state you cannot modify your contribution.
  • Modify: When the curator sends the contribution back to you for further editing along with the comments.
  • Accepted: When your contribution has been accepted by the curator and is now under the second review phase. At this state you cannot modify your contribution.
  • Published on ICP: When your contribution has been published on the Indian Culture Portal. At this state you cannot modify your contribution.

fields.question: I don’t find the desired Place of Worship. How to add it?
fields.answer: To add a pow, click on the desired faith, then click on the “Click to add a PoW” button, provide the necessary information and click Submit. The request is reviewed and on successful verification, the PoW is created and is displayed under the list of places of worship. Whereas if a revision is needed, a request for modification is sent to the user.

fields.question: What will I be notified of, when, and how?
fields.answer:
You will be notified on your registered email address for the following:
  • Your contribution
    1. has been taken up for review by the curator
    2. needs modification based on the comments given by the curator
    3. has been accepted and is under the 2nd review phase
    4. has been published on the ICP portal
    5. has been rejected based on the comments given by the curator
  • Your request for creation of a new place of worship:
    1. has been accepted by the curator
    2. needs modification
    3. has been rejected by the curator based on the comments given

fields.question: Where is my contribution published?
fields.answer: The eligible contributions are published on the Indian Culture Portal (https://indianculture.gov.in).

fields.question: Is my contribution published as is or will modifications be made by the curator.?
fields.answer: If the curator feels that no modifications are required, then your content will be published as is along with the other contributions received in all categories under the particular place of worship. However, the curator can modify/reword/rewrite based on the contribution made by you.

fields.question: I have spotted some issues with the place of worship content published on the Indian Culture Portal. Whom and where should I report to?
fields.answer: At first, login and navigate to the desired faith and locate the place of worship. Click the feedback link and follow the instructions on the screen to notify us about the issue spotted.

fields.question: Can I become a curator? If yes, how?
fields.answer: A curator needs to have a good flair for writing and must have a keen interest in all the faiths. He/she should be able to verify and state facts for a place of worship without favoring any faith. He/She must also possess proofreading and editing skills so as to curate the contributions made by others. If you feel you are eligible for being a curator, then feel free to write an email to us at ___________________. We will acknowledge you with further instructions.

fields.question: How to Sign up (register) on the Places of Worship portal?
fields.answer: You can register using a valid email address on the following page: https://pow.nvli.in/signup/

fields.question: How to reset password?
fields.answer: You can reset your password by following the instructions given on the Forgot Password page: https://pow.nvli.in/reset/

fields.question: I am facing problems regarding registration or log in. What do I do?
fields.answer: In case you are facing any problem regarding the registration or login process, please write to us at ___________________. We would be more than happy to get back to you and help in solving issues you may face while browsing and/or participating through the Places of Worship portal.

fields.question: What are the policies of the Indian Culture portal?
fields.answer:
1. Privacy Policy
  2. Terms and Conditions

fields.question: How do I find the signup page?
fields.answer: Click Signup link located in the top right corner, or click here to go to the signup page

fields.question: How do find the Login page?
fields.answer: Click Login link located in the top right corner, or click here to go to the login page

fields.question: How do find the reset password page?
fields.answer: Click Login link located in the top right corner and click forgot password, or click here to go to the reset password page
